blog.name: aryathenightwolf
blog.title: The Night Wolf
blog.description: Blog dedicated to Game of Thrones and my favourite character from the show and the books, the amazing Arya Stark... Once every hundred years I post about other things too

tags: So even if she is not super in love with the idea of having kids she would be an amazing fierce mom
summary: Is there any basis to the idea that Arya would hate to be a mother? I've seen it around lately in some places and it just...
body:
Is there any basis to the idea that Arya would hate to be a mother? I’ve seen it around lately in some places and it just surprises me because Arya is so young and in such dangerous circumstances she never even thinks about the idea of being a mother.

She doesn’t reject it nor accept it because it simply doesn’t cross her mind.

And also she protected Weasel as much as she could and enjoyed playing with the servants kids and naming their babes so once again I must wonder if people actually read the books or just uses them as part of the decor.

It could be that, in the future, Arya doesn’t want any kids.

But as far as we know, is not something she ever rejected.

blog.name: lotsoffandomimagines
blog.title: ✎ Just Imagine It ✎
blog.description:
☆ masterlist → rules → fandom list → about → fav imagines ☆
Hi! The name’s Ace. My blog runs on requests so send them in, but read my rules and fandom list before doing so! Gifs aren't mine. OC information is in my “about” link. Last but not least, this is a safe space for everyone! Be nice to each other and let your imagination soar.

summary:
Requested by anonymous 
You were preparing your horse for the long trip to King’s Landing, when you were approached by your twin...
body:
Requested by anonymous

You were preparing your horse for the long trip to King’s Landing, when you were approached by your twin Robb. “It won’t be the same with you gone” Robb commented as you turned to grin at him. “How are you feeling?”.

“Truthfully dear brother, I hate this whole thing” you admitted with a bitter chuckle. It was true, even though you had agreed to go to King’s Landing it didn’t bring you joy to do so. Staying in Winterfell with your mother, Robb, Theon, and an injured Bran was much more favourable. However, your father had requested that you come and you couldn’t refuse him. “Unfortunately, someone needs to keep Arya out of trouble and I make sure Robert’s brat of a son is worthy enough of Sansa” you added as you mounted your horse.

“I don’t believe Joffrey should be your biggest concern. There are other… unsavoury people that’ll be in your party” Robb replied, his eyes shifting towards Jaime Lannister, who stood a few yards away from you two. “I strongly advise you to keep an eye on those Lannisters. There’s something not right about them. Something… corrupt” Robb continued, his tone becoming hushed so the King Slayer wouldn’t accidentally overhear the discussion you were having.

Robb’s words caused you to nod firmly. “It’s like you read my mind brother” you agreed, sending Jaime a quick suspicious glare. “I’love write to you. I hope you’ll do the same, tell me how Bran’s doing”. Robb without hesitation Robb assured you that he would. “Good, well I suppose this is goodbye, for for now”.

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

blog.name: swedishlemoncake
blog.description: ASOIAF/GoT related content | Gendrya | Theonsa | Jonerys | Sometimes I post art

summary: If it was up to you, how would you end GoT? :)
question: If it was up to you, how would you end GoT? :)
answer:
Oh boy that’s a tough question but I’ll try

Daenerys: Never goes mad or burns KL but ends up getting the iron throne. After the war against Cersei is done she is crowned queen of the five kingdoms (-the north and the iron islands) and marries Jon. In their last scene together a bump is visible on her belly indicating that she is pregnant with their first child. Rheagal never dies.

Jon: Kills the Night King. Accepts his identity as both a Targaryen and a Stark and rules in KL with his wife. Ghost dislikes the warm weather but after a good shave and a personal swimming pool he’s fine.

Sansa: QITN! QITN! QITN!

Arya: Sails west but eventually returns to Westeros. Settles down at Storm’s End and marries Gendry. Visits her remaining family regularly. Alternatively traveling the world with Gendry.

Bran: Becomes a higher power or a tree or something Idk. The writers fucked him up. Perhaps it would be nice if he married Meera and reclaimed his humanity somehow. Or stayed in WF with Sansa.

Cersei: Strangled by Jaime after she wants to burn down KL with wildfire.

Jaime: Sleeps with Brienne after the Battle of Winterfell but leaves for KL after he hears about his sister’s plans. He promises Brienne to come back to her afterwards and admits that he loves her. She accepts but eventually changes her mind and decides to go after him. After Cersei is killed he gets stabbed by Euron but manages to stay alive long enough for Brienne to find him. He dies in her arms.

Tyrion: The writers have done him dirty since season 4. They completely messed up his character by putting him in the background. In later seasons the only things he does is crack stupid jokes and fuck up Dany’s plans. And since he has proven to be such a shitty hand (remember the seven years, anyone??) It would’ve left a bitter taste in my mouth seeing him continue to serve the queen. I guess it would’ve been kind of nice seeing him make his own wine in some distant corner of the world but I would’ve been just as fine with him dying too.

Sam: Grand Maester and happily married to Gilly.

Missandei & Greyworm: Alive and still part of Dany’s squad. Going on occasional vacations to Naarth.

Jorah: Serves as Dany’s new hand.

Theon: Sansa’s Hand and not so secret lover. She wants to marry him but he doesn’t want to be king. Perhaps he will agree to it one day. Hero of Winterfell. Forgiven by everyone. Forms a close friendship with Pod. If anyone deserved a happy ending it was Theon. (And Sansa)

Brienne: After Jaime, she returns to the north to serve as Sansa’s Queen’s Guard. Perhaps she maybe possibly probably starts to like Tormund after some time has gone by. Just a bit.

Podrick: Becomes ser Podrick Payne. Stays with Brienne and Sansa. Hangs out with Theon.

Davos: Master of Ships. Jon’s most trusted adviser.

Bronn: Gets his damn castle I suppose. I couldn’t care less.

Qyburn: Killed by the Mountain. I loved Qyburn’s death. His experiment was too bold in the end indeed.

Yara: Queen of the Iron Islands. Visits Theon regularly in Winterfell. Mainly to tease him about Sansa.

Sandor: Dies fighting and killing the Mountain.

Euron: killed by Jaime or Yara/Theon.

Melisandre: Dies during the battle of Winterfell.

blog.name: aqueenofmarble
blog.title: Do I Dare Disturb the Universe?

summary: Don’t ya’ll love how Arya goes on about Gendry’s deep blue eyes in the books? She doesn’t just say “he had blue eyes”. No, she...
body: Don’t ya’ll love how Arya goes on about Gendry’s deep blue eyes in the books? She doesn’t just say “he had blue eyes”. No, she says he has “deep blue eyes” which is a big sign that she’s attracted to him imo. Ned, for instance, describes his eyes as being “ice blue” which is very different from “deep blue”. Not only is “deep blue” darker and when eyes get darker it’s usually a sign of attraction because you’re pupils dilate when you see sth or someone you like. But it also sounds a lot more romantic than “ice blue”. The latter is very matter-of-factly, very detached, very objective. The former is a more dreamy, vague, subjective way to describe the colour. Again, more romantic because it’s not about the eye colour itself rather about the vibe, the impression. The description serves as a basis for an attraction and eventual romance. Yeah guys, love comes in at the eyes.

tags: honorable lies = the ones you say to save your family
summary: “We all lie,” her father said” (...)  “but it was right, wasn’t it? The queen would have killed her.” “It was right,” her father...
body:
“We all lie,” her father said”

(…) 

“but it was right, wasn’t it? The queen would have killed her.”

“It was right,” her father said. “And even the lie was…not without honor.”

—A Game of Thrones - Arya II

¡¡¡We 

all 

lie!!! 

:Ned Stark and the unique concept of ‘honorable lies’:

reblog.comment:

blog.description: I write shipfic for Game of Thrones/ASOIAF and Pitch. Other favorites include Crazy Ex-Girlfriend, The Good Place, Justified, The Expanse, Veronica Mars, Farscape, Star Wars, the MCU, and the Chicago Cubs.

summary: Edge of Tomorrow AU. Jaime Lannister dies under the Red Keep and wakes at Winterfell. And then it happens again, and again....
caption:
Edge of Tomorrow AU. Jaime Lannister dies under the Red Keep and wakes at Winterfell. And then it happens again, and again. After struggling to avert disaster on his own, he enlists the help of Arya Stark, who went through the same thing in the Battle of Winterfell, and Sandor Clegane.

Chapter 8: Arya trains Jaime, and they try again to stop the burning of King’s Landing.

Banner by Ro Nordmann.

summary: 6SS: Sansa & Arya: Night In
title: 6SS: Sansa & Arya: Night In
body:
“Are you going to the party Robb is throwing to celebrate his new promotion?”

Arya shook her head, “Nah, I feel bad, my period’s real bad this time and I just,” Arya shrugged, “want to stay home and in bed, not in the mood for drunken shenanigans.”

Sansa nodded at her sister, “If you’re not going, then I’m not going, wouldn’t be fun without you.”

Arya’s eyebrows shot up, “That’s first… isn’t Daenerys going?”

“She’s not,” Sansa said, “Family thing, she said… so how about this, I’ll make us a chocolate cake - hush chocolate is a must during periods -, get some take out and we’ll do a movie marathon, your choice.”

“Who are you and what did you do to my sister,” Arya said, shock written on her face, “but you know what, even if you’re an alien, that sounds nice.”

summary: 6SS: Sansa & Arya: Spies
title: 6SS: Sansa & Arya: Spies
body:
They met on the bathroom of the bar, it wasn’t the ideal location, but necessity called for it, “I have the usb with the data you need,” Arya told her sister.

“Oh good,” Sansa smiled, “I’m glad you got it, honestly, you’re the best hacker I know!”

Arya flushed at her sister’s praise, glad the bathroom light was low, “Here, take it quick!”

Sansa look the usb, quickly placing it on the empty lipstick case, “Honestly, I don’t know what I would do without you, I might be good at getting people to think I’m harmless, but you are an excellent hacker and sharpshooter.”

Arya smiled at her sister, “Thank you, and who would have thought that we’d end up working to take down Tywin Lannister and his family?”

Sansa snorted, “Not anyone who met us in high school, but, gotta run now, take care, will contact you tomorrow, be safe, Cat.”

summary: Cat of the Canals AU In which a girl cannot be Arya Stark, will not be No One, and so becomes someone else altogether. And...
caption:
Cat of the Canals AU

In which a girl cannot be Arya Stark, will not be No One, and so becomes someone else altogether. And truly, life as a Braavosi urchin is not so bad. It would do…for now.

Part of my GoT in Art series

* Original painting is The Unwelcome Companion: A Street Scene in Cairo by John William Waterhouse

Click on the pic to see it in higher-res.

summary: All the dany stans who keep calling the starks xenophobes and crticising them for not trusting anyone who isn't them are so...
question: All the dany stans who keep calling the starks xenophobes and crticising them for not trusting anyone who isn't them are so fucking annoying. They went through so much, they were betrayed and abused by everyone, they are obviously traumtised. It's completely understandable that they would only trust each other and be vary of outsiders, especially someone like daenerys, who has dragons and could've burned the north whenever she wanted.
answer:
It’s not xenophobia to distrust an untrustworthy individual. i’ve talked about sansa’s perspective a lot, let me focus on arya. daenerys:

  • invaded westeros with 3 large dragons
  • imprisoned jon, the person arya loved most, when he came to entreat daenerys to help him
  • tyrion came up with the wight hunt because daenerys was more concerned with the throne than the night king. now arya would not know this but she knows jon went on this dangerous mission with only 12 men on daenerys’ behalf
  • daenerys handed the night king dragons which allowed him to cross the wall and kill northerners. arya stark would never be buddy buddy with someone like this esp
  • when daenerys came to winterfell scaring the smallfolk and behaving like an imperialist dickhead
  • arya was not at the meeting but many people were and she would know daenerys’ response to the food question was ‘my dragons will eat whatever they want.’
  • finally arya’s main problem was that jon snow was behaving like a dick when sansa said the soldiers should rest. it’s a reasonable point and his behaviour was concerning

what did morons think ‘the lone wolf dies but the pack survives’ mean? also after years of making fun of ned, catelyn and robb for believing what their enemies said, folks want to get angry at arya for being smart enough to see who daenerys really was. the nerve.

  • finally arya’s main problem was that jon snow was behaving like a dick when sansa said the soldiers should rest. it’s a reasonable point and his behaviour was concerning

summary: I just saw a post from an arya blog where they listed changes they made from book!arya. And one of them was how in the show she...
question: I just saw a post from an arya blog where they listed changes they made from book!arya. And one of them was how in the show she bullied her sister while in the books it was the other way around. And I mean I haven't read the books in a long time but I'm pretty sure they were both kinda awful to each other. They also said they made her a xenophobe and isolationist and I'm honestly so fucking tired of this bullshit. Anyway, I know you're not a big fan of arya but I had to rant to someone
answer:
I am reformed anon. I like Arya now. Anyway Sansa and Arya’s relationship only got bad after Lady was killed. Before that they didn’t understand each other or see eye to eye but they mostly avoided each other. When the ‘trial’ happened Sansa chose to be neutral and Arya hit her repeatedly and then Ned killed Lady. By this point Mycah had already been murdered so in the morning, Sansa decided that it was all Arya’s fault because she attacked Joffrey and Nymeria got away with Arya’s help. Ned did not intervene, in fact according to his chapter he could not look at Sansa without getting angry so either he refused to look at Sansa or every time he looked her Sansa could see he was angry. Meanwhile Ned and Arya’s relationship is doing just fine. Ned by the way very obviously prefers Arya over Sansa which exacerbates the situation. Basically Sansa wants to get angry at Ned but she can’t because he is her father and she was raised to be obedient so she channels all her anger at Arya by ignoring her and then saying something mean. 

The worst of it happened when Ned decided that they were going to leave. Arya knew they weren’t safe but Sansa was told nothing. As far as Sansa was concerned she was being punished for no good reason so she lashed out. The show actually changed things by making Sansa angry at Ned and really everybody but in the books she projected her anger at Arya because it was easier.

As for the rest of your ask, I doubt that person actually likes Arya. I think they stan Dany instead or they are angry that Sansa and Arya agree on something. It’s not xenophobia to dislike an invader, it’s not isolationist to side eye your brother for not caring about his soldiers.

Basically Sansa wants to get angry at Ned but she can’t because he is her father and she was raised to be obedient so she channels all her anger at Arya by ignoring her and then saying something mean. 

The worst of it happened when Ned decided that they were going to leave. Arya knew they weren’t safe but Sansa was told nothing. As far as Sansa was concerned she was being punished for no good reason so she lashed out. The show actually changed things by making Sansa angry at Ned and really everybody but in the books she projected her anger at Arya because it was easier.

As for the rest of your ask, I doubt that person actually likes Arya. I think they stan Dany instead or they are angry that Sansa and Arya agree on something. It’s not xenophobia to dislike an invader, it’s not isolationist to side eye your brother for not caring about his soldiers.

blog.name: gendry
blog.title: wilder things
blog.description: You are Arya of Winterfell, daughter of the North. You told me you could be strong. You have the wolf blood in you. #usergendry
